title: Calories in a Tomato Slice
meta_description: Discover calories in tomato slice, including macros like carbs, fiber, and vitamins, plus per-100g basis and preparation tweaks for your diet.
assumptions: One medium slice from a fresh, ripe tomato, approximately 20g; raw, no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by tomato variety, ripeness, size of slice, and growing conditions. Check produce labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A single tomato slice contains about 4 calories and provides vitamins A and C.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

faqs.q: How many calories in one tomato slice?
faqs.a: Approximately 4 calories for a 20g medium slice.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in a tomato slice besides calories?
faqs.a: About 0.8g carbs, 0.2g fiber, and low fat; rich in lycopene and vitamin C.

faqs.q: Are calories in tomato slice different for cherry tomatoes?
faqs.a: Yes, a cherry tomato slice is smaller (~10g) with ~2 calories.

faqs.q: Does cooking affect calories in tomato slice?
faqs.a: Minimal change if roasted without oil; adds flavor but calories stay low unless oil is added.

faqs.q: How many tomato slices equal 100 calories?
